This used to be one of my favorite apps. I used to look up at the sky throughout the day just to see what was out there...However, now, this same app has been taken an incredibly HORRIBLE turn for the worse!!ðŸ˜¡ when u turn on this app, I'm confronted by STUPID ads that take up a part or all of the page!!! I don't open a star app to see the wonders of Amazon or Google!!! I want to see the constellations, the moon, the sun, and the planets!!!! Delete these ads or I'll use an ad free star app, and tell everyone I know how you guys turned a fantastic app into a pile of soggy garbage that serves to overpower people with ads!!! Very disappointed in this app, it used to be one of my favorites. ðŸŒŒðŸ˜¢ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡

title.label: Dismaying!  Don't waste your on this... Google ads everywhere!

content.label:
One of the poorest opening experiences with an app ever...

Right when one starts, there is a FULL-SCREEN ad from Google!  That's not pleasant at all and destroys any illusion of seeing the night sky and good feelings towards a new app.

Then, when one taps on the Settings icon, which opens up an info screen, we're led into a labyrinth!  It explains there is an icon that turns off the compass mode and another that gives Earth view.  However, when one returns to the  view of the sky, there are NO icons!  Hence, there is no way of turning off the compass mode and no way of doing anything else.

Yet, while the sky moves around wildly, there is another ad from Google that remains fixed in the upper-left hand part of the sky!  That's off-putting, too.

Compounding the interface disaster, the night sky is transparent, showing the status bar in the background in the sky!  Truly bizarre and the only astro app I have or know of that behaves this way --and I have scores of them.

Oh, well!  Maybe if the developers go back to the drawing board and realizes that first impressions matter a lot-- and that ads have no place in an astronomy app, especially not when they appear as banners in the night sky or take over the whole display-- they could create a viable astro app.

Come on, guys and gals--whet our appetites with a free, light version *without* ads, then make your money off of the pro version.  The current approach is just tawdry!  Of course, NOT having controls on the screen that are supposed to be there just compounds the problems!

I really hate to be so blunt, as I know how much effort goes into programming, but an opening that leads users into confusion is not smart or good design--and users being frank can prove helpful in guiding new versions!

------
Update:  I decided to quit and reopen the app one more time to see if there was something I missed.  This time, the entire screen was not only taken over by a Google ad, but it was an audio one, too with loud volume!  Sorry, but being blunt is necessary!  Fix this!  Or, are you just being quick-and-dirty shills for Google?!
I like researching the constellations and that sort of thing. This app makes it so easy.

title.label: Total waste of time. Just a way to spam you with ads.

content.label:
Warning: Just adware! Download a real astronomy app; don't waste your time with this.
This is very lousy. It's one of numerous virtually identical lousy pseudo-astronomy apps. 
There are at least 5 apps in the App Store which are using this exact same starviewing engine. Some may have a slightly different user interface, but they are all the same weak, nearly useless engine.
They are basically just vehicles for ads.
The 5 identical apps I've found are:
Starglobe (Azurcoding), Sky Walk (Vimal Bhanvadiya), Star Discovery (Ujjawal Wadekar), NightSky Exploration (Ujjawal Wadekar), Stars & Constellations (Divya Mishra).
I don't know why this junk is allowed in the App Store.
Ads in the middle of the screen make this app useless! Avoid!
Awful pop ups in the middle of the screen!
Don't buy. You pay money to not have pop ups. Pop ups are right in middle of screen. Can't get rid of them.

I got this app hoping to see other object in the sky besides stars and planets, I have a better app which can show me more than that. Don't waste your money just go and purchase Star Rover by EEFan Inc.

If you're looking for an alternative to the now dysfunctional StarWalk, keep looking. The compass is inaccurate and unrelated ads continually pop up on the screen. I wish I could be reimbursed for this travesty.
